content: Investments General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 19 Sep 2018How does dividend payout work? For example I have 100 S51 shares in my CDP, and the final dividend was announced at 0.02 cents, why the payout is only $1?Thank you, I'm a beginner to investments at the moment1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 20 Sep 2018This is how to calculate your dividend amount​Dividend per share * total shares held before XD ​So if you had 100 shares of S51 and the dividend announced is 0.01 then you will receive 100 * 0.01 = $1 0 comments0
